ET.description: Time to develop this type of attack is short as the format is standardized

SE.description: While UDS is a standardized protocol, knowing how to use it as an exploit point requires greater expertise

KoIC.description: Some elements of the vehicle that the attacker may want access to could be proprietary

WoO.description: Access to the vehicles UDS access point is required

Eq.description: UDS reader/writers are quite easy and affordable

SubThreats.Description: An attacker exploits the UDS protocol to gain access over vehicle systems

ET.description: Simly preventing the connection is all that is required for this attack to function

SE.description: Knowledge of how to prevent the vehicle from communicating with its software update server is required

KoIC.description: Simply understanding how to prevent wireless communication is required for this attack

Eq.description: Some fairly minor specialized equipment would be required for this attack

SubThreats.Description: An attacker disables a vehicles capability to update its software. This type of attack is typically done in order to use an exploit that is found within the vehicles current version of the software

SubThreats.ThreatName: Modify OS Kernel, Boot Partition, or System Partition

ET.description: Finding an exploit for this could take quite sometime, particularly if the researcher has difficulty reverse engineering the OS

SE.description: General knowledge of OS kernels, their operation, and how to gain access to them is required for this type of attack

KoIC.description: The attackers need to know several aspects about the boot, os, and kernel layer of the OS in order to perform this type of attack

WoO.description: All surfaces of this attack are used upon vehicle startup, but if physical access to the vehicle is required this step becomes more difficult

Eq.description: A standard computer and something to physically modify the kernel is required for this attack

SubThreats.Description: An attacker modifies the base level of a vehicles operating system

ET.description: A deep understanding of the vehicle architecture, controls, and various cryptography methods used must be understood before this attack can work

SE.description: The attacker must be able to identify what is within the TEE, how to break into it, and then how to gain access to the information that they are seeking

KoIC.description: Some knowledge of internal systems is required for this attack

WoO.description: the TEE surface is available every time the vehicle is used

SubThreats.Description: An attacker changes the trusted execution environment of the vehicle
